content.value: Follow these guidelines, and you and your friends will all be able to enjoy your cricket to the full.
Percy Main Junior Players should:
Respect the rights of every other player to play cricket with you.
Expect to be treated with respect, courtesy and consideration by your coach
THINK SAFETY DURING ALL COACHING SESSIONS, PRACTICES AND DRILLS!!
Respect and listen carefully to your coaches’ instructions at all times – they may be about your personal safety!
Take responsibility for your own actions:
Wear appropriate clothing – for personal comfort, warmth and safety; wear sun cream/hats during sunny day
Arrive punctually for your sessions – be ready to go at the appropriate time
If you cannot make a session, please advise the coach at the very earliest opportunity.
Always bring and wear the right safety equipment at all times – if you are not sure, ask your coach!

If you have issues with the direction of the coaching programme or anything that has happened within it, please discuss with Tony (involving parents as well if you would like); if further discussions are needed, this can then be raised in committee, and ultimately resolved with the Club Welfare Officer.
Percy Main Club will not tolerate bullying of any kind
If you have a problem, or if you see bullying going on, please tell our welfare officer Paddy Rathbone, or if you prefer any of the other coaches.
We will listen and appropriate action will be taken
as governed by club constitution and Safe Hands guidelines.
Always accept Umpire’s decisions
Without

dissent or argument. Please accept the decision, and walk from the wicket without hitting the ground, hitting your pads, and without shaking your head. This is an ECB guideline and failure to comply with this could result in a match ban. We understand disappointment, but you must learn to deal with it appropriately.
Never abuse or taunt an opponent
Always encourage a team mate, even if they make a mistake – they have not done it deliberately!
Respect the club’s equipment, and that of each other.
Coaching Team

Tony has coached cricket for 38 and bit years and has been a volunteer coach at Percy Main for about 30 years, having started playing for the club when he was 12 years old. He has played at a couple of other clubs but found himself back at the Main around 20 years ago.

In real life he has always been involved in sport, and coaching in particular. His first full time job was for Leisure Services at Harrogate Borough Council, after which he moved home to work for the Football Development scheme for 10 years in Newcastle. He then set up and managed the Newcastle Cricket Development Scheme for the next 8 years.

In 2010 he got a job at the England and Wales Cricket Board as a Regional Training Manager in Coach Education, then moved for a couple of years in the same company to National Coach Developer Network Lead. Both jobs for the ECB involved developing and delivering new cricket coaching courses, a bit of travelling to foreign lands and plenty of training across the country to prepare the National Coach Development delivery workforce for action.
In 2020 he started working for himself - Coaching, Mentoring and Player Development, with current work including
Volunteer Junior Coach Percy Main Cricket Club
Various Male and Female County Age Group Coaching with Northumberland U11s to Men and Women 1st Teams
National Coach Developer delivering Coach Educator Training for ECB
Assessor and mentor on ECB Advanced Course
Working with various Clubs/Counties helping coaches develop their craft
Some 1-2-1 Coaching with both players and coaches
Northern Diamonds Academy Wicket keepers
Coach Development Courses in various Counties and a couple of Universities
Dave is part of our junior coaching team. He has enjoyed coaching during the past year, seeing players enjoy and developing their skills.
Qualifications
ECB Support Course 2023
ECB Foundation course March & April 2025
Alex has played cricket at Percy Main for 9 years, playing and captaining the Sunday 3rd XI, Midweek XI, 2nd XI, and in 2025 the 1st XI.
Known as
Big Al
Qualifications
ECB Foundation Coach
Oli has played
at the club since the age of 10, and began his coaching journey by helping Tony coach the under 11’s. He loves the club and hope to be coaching for many more years.
Qualifications
ECB Foundation Coach
ECB Support Coach

Steve first qualified as a coach in 2002 and went on to gain level 2 coaching status in 2004. He was lucky enough to train at Warwickshire County Cricket Club and he coached juniors at Marsten Green Cricket Club in Birmingham.

When he relocated back to the North East, he established junior cricket at Percy Main after many years without a junior section. In the late 2000s he took time away from coaching due to family commitments but he has now reactivated his qualifications, and is excited at the prospect of passing on his knowledge and experience to the all the young players at the club. As a batsman, Steve is particularly keen to help young players develop the technical batting skills and mental focus that is needed to succeed in the game.
Qualifications
ECB Level 2 Coach
Cricket has been played in Percy Main since the foundation of the club in 1860.

players' code of conduct.
